title: Pastry Crust Mix
ingredients: 1 cup shortening, chilled and cut into bits
instructions: Mix the dry ingredients together then blend the shortening with a pastry blender until the mixture is of “pebbly” consistency.
Store in a covered container in the refrigerator.

Moisten the measured out pastry mix with enough ice water to hold dough together when pushed lightly with a fork.  Roll the dough into one or two balls, depending on what one is making, and flatten into rounds.  Wrap the rounds in wax paper and place in the refrigerator for an hour.  Remove from the refrigerator and roll out on a lightly floured board or pastry cloth.
When the recipe calls for a pre-baked shell or shells, line the greased pan with the dough, prick well with a fork and bake at 425° F. for 12 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remarks:  An excellent recipe.  I’ve had great success with this recipe.
Yield:  4½ cups of pastry dough mix.
Source:  The Williamsburg Cookbook, Updated 1975 Edition, Published by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, Williamsburg, Virginia.
